video.title: TEDTalks: Space Trek
video.synopsis: Brilliant minds give clues about ancient celestial life forms, future spacecraft and the universe's most peculiar places.

episodes.synopsis: A planetary scientist shows images from the Cassini voyage to Saturn, whose frozen moon Enceladus seems to shoot jets of ice.
episodes.title: Carolyn Porco Flies Us to Saturn

episodes.synopsis: With humor, Phil Plait enthralls audience with all the ways asteroids can kill, and what we must do to avoid them.
episodes.title: Phil Plait: How to Defend Earth from Asteroids

episodes.synopsis: A maverick cave explorer discusses his efforts to mine lunar ice for space fuel and to build a robot to study Jupiter's moon.
episodes.title: Bill Stone Explores the World's Deepest Caves

episodes.synopsis: Brian Cox explains how curiosity-driven science pays for itself, powering innovation and appreciation of our existence.
episodes.title: Brian Cox: Why We Need the Explorers

episodes.synopsis: The SETI Institute's Jill Tarter makes her TED Prize wish: to accelerate our search for cosmic company.
episodes.title: Jill Tarter's Call to Join the SETI Search

episodes.synopsis: An astronomer searches to answer questions about the origin and existence of biological life elsewhere (and on Earth).
episodes.title: Dimitar Sasselov: How We Found Hundreds of Potential Earth-like Planets

episodes.synopsis: Physicist Janna Levin says the universe has a soundtrack that records some of the most dramatic events in outer space.
episodes.title: Janna Levin: The Sound the Universe Makes

episodes.synopsis: A TED Fellow has helped find 1,200 potential new planets. Some may have the right conditions for life.
episodes.title: Lucianne Walkowicz: Finding Planets Around Other Stars

episodes.synopsis: X Prize founder Peter Diamandis talks about how he helped Stephen Hawking fulfill his dream of going to space.
episodes.title: Peter Diamandis on Stephen Hawking in Zero G

episodes.synopsis: Charles Elachi shares stories from NASA's legendary Jet Propulsion Lab, including tales and video from the Mars Rover project.
episodes.title: Charles Elachi on the Mars Rovers

episodes.synopsis: Carter Emmart demos stunning 3D visualization of the universe and explains how it's shared with facilities around the world.
episodes.title: Carter Emmart Demos a 3D Atlas of the Universe

episodes.synopsis: A physicist suggests how we might find life on the moons of Jupiter and a few other places in the universe.
episodes.title: Freeman Dyson Says: Let's Look for Life in the Outer Solar System

episodes.synopsis: A spectroscopist gives an accessible explanation of his field, which may be coming close to finding a life-friendly planet.
episodes.title: Garik Israelian: How Spectroscopy Could Reveal Alien Life

episodes.synopsis: An artist-technologist listens to the noises of stars, including the sound of cosmic rays left over from the Big Bang.
episodes.title: Honor Harger: A History of the Universe in Sound

episodes.synopsis: Physicist Patricia Burchat sheds light on two basic ingredients of our universe: dark matter and dark energy.
episodes.title: Patricia Burchat Sheds Light on Dark Matter

episodes.synopsis: Carolyn Porco shares exciting new findings from the Cassini spacecraft's recent sweep of one of Saturn's moons, Enceladus.
episodes.title: Carolyn Porco: Could a Saturn Moon Harbor Life?

episodes.synopsis: An author spins the story of Project Orion, a nuclear-powered spacecraft that could have taken us to Saturn in five years.
episodes.title: George Dyson on Project Orion

episodes.synopsis: A scientist thinks there's a good chance that life might exist on Mars. She details how we should look and why.
episodes.title: Penelope Boston Says There Might Be Life on Mars

episodes.synopsis: An astrophysicist shows stunning images from deep-space surveys, and prods us to ponder how the cosmos got built.
episodes.title: George Smoot on the Design of the Universe

episodes.synopsis: Andrea Ghez shows how adaptive optics are helping astronomers understand our universe's most mysterious objects: black holes.
episodes.title: Andrea Ghez: The Hunt for a Supermassive Black Hole
